detaileddescription.para: This is an IntVect all of whose components are equal to zero.
This is an IntVect all of whose components are equal to one.

briefdescription.para: Construct an IntVect whose components are all zero.

param.type: AMREX_D_DECL(int i, int j, int k)

briefdescription.para: Construct an IntVect given the specific values for its coordinates. AMREX_D_DECL is a macro that sets the constructor to take AMREX_SPACEDIM arguments.
Construct an IntVect setting the coordinates to the corresponding values in the integer array a.
Construct an IntVect from an Vector<int>. It is an error if the Vector<int> doesn' t have the same dimension as this IntVect.

detaileddescription.para: Sum of all components of this IntVect.

briefdescription.para: maximum (no absolute values) value
minimum (no absolute values) value

Returns the i'th coordinate of the IntVect.
Set i'th coordinate of IntVect to val.
Returns a const pointer to an array of coordinates of the IntVect. Useful for arguments to FORTRAN calls.
Returns true if all components are equal to the argument val.
Returns true if any component is not equal to the argument val.
Returns true if this is equivalent to rhs.
Returns true if this is different from rhs.
Return ture if this is lexicographically less than rhs.
Return true if this is lexicographically less than or equal to rhs.
Retrun true if this is lexicographically greater than rhs.
Retrun true if this is lexicographically greater than or equal to rhs.
Returns true if this is less than argument for all components. NOTE: This is NOT a strict weak ordering usable by STL sorting algorithms.
Returns true if this is less than or equal to argument for all components. NOTE: This is NOT a strict weak ordering usable by STL sorting algorithms.
Returns true if this is greater than argument for all components. NOTE: This is NOT a strict weak ordering usable by STL sorting algorithms.
Returns true if this is greater than or equal to argument for all components. NOTE: This is NOT a strict weak ordering usable by STL sorting algorithms.
Unary plus for completeness.
Unary Minus negates all components.

Modifies IntVect by component-wise addition with argument.
Modifies IntVect by multiplication of a scalar to each component.

Modifies IntVect by component-wise division with argument.
Modifies IntVect by subtraction of a scalar to each component.
Modifies IntVect by component-wise subtraction with argument.

Return an IntVect that is this IntVect + s.
Returns component-wise difference of IntVect and argument.
Return an IntVect that is this IntVect - s.
Returns component-wise product of IntVect and argument.
Returns component-wise product of IntVect and s.
Returns component-wise division of IntVect by argument.
Returns component-wise division of IntVect by s.
Modifies IntVect by taking component-wise min with argument.
Modifies IntVect by taking component-wise max with argument.
Modify IntVect by multiplying each coordinate by s.
Modify IntVect by reflecting it in the plane defined by the index ref_ix and with normal in the direction of idir.
Modify IntVect by adding s to given coordinate.
Equivalent to shift(0,iv[0]).shift(1,iv[1]) ...
Modify IntVect by adding s to each coordinate.

Modify IntVect by component-wise integer projection.

memberdef.definition: AMREX_GPU_HOST_DEVICE static AMREX_INLINE constexpr IntVect amrex::IntVect::TheZeroVector
memberdef.name: TheZeroVector

briefdescription.para: This static member function returns a reference to a constant IntVect object, all of whose AMREX_SPACEDIM arguments are set to zero (0). Figuratively, it is the zero vector in AMREX_SPACEDIM-dimensional space. It is provided as a convenient way to specify the zero vector.

memberdef.definition: AMREX_GPU_HOST_DEVICE static AMREX_INLINE constexpr IntVect amrex::IntVect::TheUnitVector
memberdef.name: TheUnitVector

briefdescription.para: This static member function returns a reference to a constant IntVect object, all of whose AMREX_SPACEDIM arguments are set to one (1). Figuratively, it is the unit vector in AMREX_SPACEDIM-dimensional space. It is provided as a convenient way to specify the unit vector.

memberdef.definition: AMREX_GPU_HOST_DEVICE static AMREX_INLINE constexpr IntVect amrex::IntVect::TheDimensionVector
memberdef.name: TheDimensionVector

briefdescription.para: This static member function returns a reference to a constant IntVect object, all of whose AMREX_SPACEDIM arguments are set to zero except that the d-direction is set to one.

memberdef.definition: AMREX_GPU_HOST_DEVICE static AMREX_INLINE constexpr IntVect amrex::IntVect::TheNodeVector
memberdef.name: TheNodeVector

briefdescription.para: This static member function returns a reference to a constant IntVect object, all of whose AMREX_SPACEDIM arguments are set to IndexType::NODE. It is provided as a convenience to our users when defining Boxes.

memberdef.definition: AMREX_GPU_HOST_DEVICE static AMREX_INLINE constexpr IntVect amrex::IntVect::TheCellVector
memberdef.name: TheCellVector

briefdescription.para: This static member function returns a reference to a constant IntVect object, all of whose AMREX_SPACEDIM arguments are set to IndexType::CELL. It is provided as a convenience to our users when defining Boxes.

memberdef.definition: AMREX_GPU_HOST_DEVICE static AMREX_INLINE constexpr IntVect amrex::IntVect::TheMaxVector
memberdef.name: TheMaxVector

memberdef.definition: AMREX_GPU_HOST_DEVICE static AMREX_INLINE constexpr IntVect amrex::IntVect::TheMinVector
memberdef.name: TheMinVector

detaileddescription.para: An Integer Vector in SPACEDIM-Dimensional Space

The class IntVect is an implementation of an integer vector in a SPACEDIM-dimensional space. It represents a point in a discrete space. IntVect values are accessed using the operator[] function, as for a normal C++ array. In addition, the basic arithmetic operators have been overloaded to implement scaling and translation operations.
